text: Under H.R. 1, taxpayer dollars will be going to support entrenched politicians and political consultants who we don’t agree with or want to support.
label: R

text: Our tax dollars should go to funding our military and protecting American citizens, not to promoting politicians we don’t even agree with. That’s why I’m voting no on H.R. 1.
label: R

text: H.R. 1 takes power away from voters and puts it in the hands of convicted criminals. The bill would strip voters of their 14th Amendment rights to limit the vote to people who haven’t been convicted of murder, violent felonies, or other serious crimes.
label: R

text: H.R. 1 is a slap in the face to our democratic system. This bill attacks the rights of the states and puts our election security at risk.
label: R

text: Under H.R. 1, there would be no checks and balances to prevent voter fraud and no penalties for ineligible individuals voting in error.
label: R

text: Same-day voter registration is a threat to our democratic process. When voters are allowed to register on the same day there is very little room to confirm identity and ensure they are voting in the correct election.
label: R

text: Every day, personal data is at risk online. With H.R. 1, the democrats would add to this threat by requiring states to maintain online voter registration with no safeguards.
label: R

text: H.R. 1 would require that all states adopt an automatic voter registration system that would rely on the federal government for records. This could lead to thousands of registration errors and the registration of ineligible voters.
label: R

text: Don’t be fooled—H.R. 1 is legislation that has been designed to fund, elect, and maintain the Democratic majority, all while ignoring states’ rights and wasting taxpayer dollars.
